intro: Turraea breviracemosa, commonly known as the short raceme turraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
